Dear Mr. McKeage:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Stephanie S Meeuwenberg, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff was a direct care staff at Bay Pines Center. Youth are given
privilege points. They can make longer phone calls, watch
television, go outside, or play electronic games if they earn
enough points. If they do not, they are not supposed to do these
things, or it is more restricted. Staff would grab Youth's butt to
make up the difference in privilege points if she did not get enough
for the day. If she was off by a point or two, he would grab her butt
to make up the difference. It is believed the touching was over the
clothing. It is unknown how many times this happened, but it
occurred every time he worked.
Investigation Interviews
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth A said
she has been placed at Bay Pines Center since December 11,
2021. Youth A said she currently gets along with all staff and does
not have any concerns about any of the current staff members.
Youth A said between December 11, 2021, and “sometime” in
February 2022 she had Staff 1 as her staff member. Youth A said
at the time Staff 1 worked as her staff, the youth were to get a
specific number of points throughout the day in order to earn
certain privileges. Youth A said any time she did not earn enough
points Staff 1 would allow her to earn points by allowing him to
touch and hold her buttocks. Youth A said at the end of the day all
youth would go into their bedrooms and Staff 1 would come to her
doorway review her points from the day with her, if she did not
earn her points Staff 1 would grab and hold her buttock over her
clothing while standing in her doorway for a minute or two, let go,
and then give her whatever points she needed to “make privs”.
Youth A denied Staff 1 touching her any other place on her body.
Youth A denied Staff 1 saying anything to her while holding her
buttock. Youth A said this occurred on all of Staff 1’s shifts. Youth A
said she is not aware of this happening with any other youth.
Youth A said she does not believe any other youth witnessed this
as she was inside her bedroom and Staff 1 was in the doorway out
of camera view. Youth A said telling Staff 2 was the first time she
had ever told any staff about this situation.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B said
she has been at Bay Pines Center since December 1, 2021. Youth
2

B said she was placed on the same unit at Youth A and had Staff 1
as a staff member. Youth B said Staff 1 was “not a good staff” as
he would “lay around being lazy, would not go to assistance calls,
did not care when girls hurt themselves, and encouraged girls to
fight each other”. Youth B said she had one incident when Staff 1
made her feel uncomfortable, explaining she was outside and
began to climb the fence and Staff 1 grabbed her around the waist
to get her down and in doing so touched her buttock. Youth B said
she felt he could have grabbed her legs, but Staff 1 told her that
was the only way he felt safe getting her down from the fence.
Youth B said Staff 1 never touched her any other time. Youth B
said she is not aware of Staff 1 touching any other youth. Youth B
said she does not have any concerns about any of the current
staff that work with her.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on June
28, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C said
she has been placed at Bay Pines Center since January 20, 2022.
Youth C said she has gotten along with staff since being placed at
Bay Pines. Youth C said she does remember Staff 1 stating “he
was not a good staff”. Youth C reported that Staff 1 would sleep
during his shift and allow the girls to do “whatever they wanted”.
Youth C said she is not aware of Staff 1 being close with any
youth. Youth C said she heard Staff 1 was not appropriate during
his restraints however was not able to give specific examples or
youth this occurred with. Youth C said Staff 1 never touched her
inappropriately. Youth C said she is not aware of Staff 1 touching
any youth in a sexual manner.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on July
20, 2023. Youth D said she was placed at Bay Pines Center in
July of 2022 and denied ever having Staff 1 as a staff member that
worked with her. Youth D said Youth A told her that Staff 1 would
touch her butt, however then stated she does not believe Youth A
as she is not always honest. Youth D said other youth told her that
Staff 1 showed “favoritism” to some youth but never touched any
youth.
Staff 1 was left a voicemail on June 26, 2023. Staff 1 returned
the phone call on June 27, 2023, and refused to be interviewed. A
letter was then sent by MDHHS worker to Staff 1 on June 27,
2023, stating the investigation would continue and should he
agree to be interviewed to contact MDHHS worker. In addition,
Law Enforcement reached out to interview Staff 1 several times
over the weekend of July 21, 2023, through July 23, 2023, with no
response. Staff 1 finally agreed to be interviewed by Law
3

Enforcement and MDHHS worker on July 24, 2023, face-to-face at
the police station. Staff 1 was very evasive when answering
questions and denied knowing what “Priv Points” were. Staff 1
said he did not remember Youth A. Staff 1 “vehemently denies
anything happened” with Youth A.
Staff 2/Complainant was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility, on June 28, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Staff 2 said he had been off work for about two weeks
and upon his return sat his group of youth down for a “circle” to
touch base on how each of them were doing since he last worked
with them. Staff 2 said when it was Youth D’s turn, she made the
comment about starting to trust staff now that certain staff are
gone. Staff 2 said he asked Youth D what she meant by that
comment, and she said Youth A told her that Staff 1 used to grab
her butt whenever she did not make her points to earn her missing
points. Staff 2 said he then asked Youth A about Youth D’s
statement and Youth A said anytime she did not make her points
Staff 1 would make the statement “let me grab your ass and I will
make sure you get your privs”. Staff 2 said he asked Youth A dates
this occurred, and she said she could not remember. Staff 2 said
this was the first he had heard about this and immediately
reported it to the supervisor on duty, group leader on call, and
DHHS. Staff 2 said he had worked with Staff 1 when he was
employed at Bay Pines Center. Staff 2 said Staff 1 was not a good
staff as he would not always follow the schedule, would make
comments to the youth that were not appropriate such as if a
youth said she was going to kill herself, Staff 1 would say “do it
then” and walk away. Staff 2 said while Staff 1 would make
inappropriate and uncaring comments to the youth, he never
suspected or had any indication of Staff 1 touching any of the
youth. Staff 2 said that while Staff 1 was employed, Bay Pines
Center was on a point system and each night after the youth were
in their rooms for bedtime the staff would usually call them out
individually and review points with them.
Documents Reviewed
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record in
the file. Staff 1 was employed at Bay Pines Center from
August 23, 2021, until June 9, 2022.
Analysis There is limited evidence that Staff 1 ever touched Youth A’s
buttocks; however after interviews with youth and staff, Staff 1
was found to lack the ability to appropriately preform the job duties
of a youth specialist as there are multiple accounts of him sleeping
on the job, encouraging youth to fight one another, making
4

inappropriate statements to the youth to preform self-harm, and
not providing the required supervision while on duty, therefore the
facility is found in noncompliance with staff qualifications.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR2021C0128043 dated 10/5/21, CAP approval dated 10/28/21.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the that the current license status be continued.
